Situation

often because of poor clinical documentation
•
Partnered with the client to analyze the Electronic Medical Records (EMR) in order to identify the correlation between EMR text and authorization denials

Approach & methodology – Neural Network Model
5
Consolidated Data
(Clinician’s Notes)
Patient Data 
(Admit Days, LOC, etc.)
Embedding
Bi-Directional LSTM
Pre-Processing
Concatenation Layer
Dense Layers
(Relu & Sigmoid)
▪
Handled missing data
▪
Converted categorical features into machine 
understandable numerical using One Hot Encoding
▪
Cleaned and transformed the data to make it suitable for NLP,  
such as handling missing values, tokenization (breaking 
sentences into words), lemmatization (transforming to root 
words), vectorization (vector representation of words)
▪
Created embedded layer by training a larger sample set of 
clinician’s notes to create a dictionary of vectors. Indexed each 
token from above layer with the dictionary of vectors
▪
LSTM architecture helps 
the model to understand 
context and important 
parts of the clinician 
notes to train upon 
▪
First dense layer embeds 
the output of the 
concatenation layer into a 
lower dimension space 
using a rectified linear unit 
activation function
▪
Second dense layer uses 
the output of the first dense 
layer to predict the 
probability of authorization 
using a sigmoid activation 
function
▪
Combined 2 datasets:             
Clinician’s Notes and Patient Data

EMR documentation report
6
•
Provides visibility into the quality of the EMR documentation over the past 
few weeks for the leadership team
•
This helps the EMR team to identify the low-performing facility and can 
improve the quality of the clinical documentation
•
Provides access to the consolidated EMR records with the ability to view the 
notes by facility, # of days into admit, clinician, patients, etc.
•
Prioritized/sorted the notes in the report that have a higher chance of leading to a 
denial in the following priority order – notes w/o medical justification, written by 
high-risk clinician, and copy-pasted records
•
This helped the UR team to identify the record of low quality, or without medical 
justification, and take course correction steps on a near real time basis
